body.p: The Gentoo Monthly Newsletter is intended to give users of Gentoo one source of information about Gentoo. The GMN summarizes the key events in the Gentoo project each month and presents them in a clear, concise format.
Here you can find the latest edition of the GMN. You can also monitor our
For feedback, comments or if you are interested in helping us out, drop in an email to gmn@gentoo.org.

tr.ti: Gentoo Council, Python updates.
Gentoo Council, Releases, Gentoo Miniconf 2014.
Gentoo Council and Foundation elections.
Interview with Patrick McLean (chutzpah), Featured New Project: Hardened Musl
Interview with Brian Dolbec (dol-sen), sys-power/upower update
Interview with Chris Reffett (creffett), Google Summer of Code 2014
Interview with Tom Wijsman (TomWij), Gentoo Galaxy
Interview with Gentoo developer Sven Vermeulen (swift)
FOSDEM 2014. Tracking orphaned packages. Restoring overlays.gentoo.org
Interview with Sergey Popov.
Interview with Richard Freeman, Gentoo as a development environment for newcomers.
GSOC 2013, SELinux System Administration, Council, Conferences
Kernel team, Incognito, Gentoo-wiki returns...
EAPI-2 approved, Gentoo-Quebec training, iotop...
PHP4 removal, GSOC interview, new Gentoo-based distributions...
2008.0 release, Gentoo at Peel Fresco Music Lounge and more...
